trans-unit.source: Searches through icon or cursor data for the icon or cursor that best fits the current display device

seg-source.mrk: Searches through icon or cursor data for the icon or cursor that best fits the current display device

target.mrk: Searches through icon or cursor data for the icon or cursor that best fits the current display device

trans-unit.source: Parameters
The icon or cursor directory data. Because this function does not validate the resource data,

seg-source.mrk: The icon or cursor directory data.
Because this function does not validate the resource data,

target.mrk: The icon or cursor directory data.
Because this function does not validate the resource data,

trans-unit.source: it causes a general protection (GP) fault or returns an undefined value if presbits is not pointing to validresource data.

seg-source.mrk: it causes a general protection (GP) fault or returns an undefined value if presbits is not pointing to validresource data.

target.mrk: it causes a general protection (GP) fault or returns an undefined value if presbits is not pointing to validresource data.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies whether an icon or a cursor is sought, valid values:

seg-source.mrk: Specifies whether an icon or a cursor is sought, valid values:

target.mrk: Specifies whether an icon or a cursor is sought, valid values:

trans-unit.source: True - The function is searching for an icon (Default).

seg-source.mrk: True - The function is searching for an icon (Default).

target.mrk: True - The function is searching for an icon (Default).

trans-unit.source: False - The function is searching for a cursor.

seg-source.mrk: False - The function is searching for a cursor.

target.mrk: False - The function is searching for a cursor.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The desired width, in pixels, of the icon or cursor.

seg-source.mrk: The desired width, in pixels, of the icon or cursor.

target.mrk: The desired width, in pixels, of the icon or cursor.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is zero (Default), the function uses the system metric value.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is zero (Default), the function uses the system metric value.

target.mrk: If this parameter is zero (Default), the function uses the system metric value.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The desired height, in pixels, of the icon or cursor.

seg-source.mrk: The desired height, in pixels, of the icon or cursor.

target.mrk: The desired height, in pixels, of the icon or cursor.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is zero (Default), the function uses the system metric value.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is zero (Default), the function uses the system metric value.

target.mrk: If this parameter is zero (Default), the function uses the system metric value.

trans-unit.source: [optional] This parameter can be one or more of the following values.

seg-source.mrk: This parameter can be one or more of the following values.

target.mrk: This parameter can be one or more of the following values.

trans-unit.source: $LR_DEFAULTCOLOR (Default)
$LR_MONOCHROME
Return Value
An integer resource identifier for the icon or cursor that best fits the current display device.

seg-source.mrk: An integer resource identifier for the icon or cursor that best fits the current display device.

target.mrk: An integer resource identifier for the icon or cursor that best fits the current display device.

trans-unit.source: 0, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

seg-source.mrk: 0, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

target.mrk: 0, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

trans-unit.source: Remarks
The icon directory is loaded from a resource file with resource type $RT_GROUP_ICON (or $RT_GROUP_CURSOR),

seg-source.mrk: The icon directory is loaded from a resource file with resource type $RT_GROUP_ICON (or $RT_GROUP_CURSOR),

target.mrk: The icon directory is loaded from a resource file with resource type $RT_GROUP_ICON (or $RT_GROUP_CURSOR),

trans-unit.source: and an integer resource name for the specific icon to be loaded.

seg-source.mrk: and an integer resource name for the specific icon to be loaded.

target.mrk: and an integer resource name for the specific icon to be loaded.

trans-unit.source: _WinAPI_LookupIconIdFromDirectoryEx() returns an integer identifier that is the resource name of the icon that best fits the current display device.

seg-source.mrk: _WinAPI_LookupIconIdFromDirectoryEx() returns an integer identifier that is the resource name of the icon that best fits the current display device.

target.mrk: _WinAPI_LookupIconIdFromDirectoryEx() returns an integer identifier that is the resource name of the icon that best fits the current display device.

trans-unit.source: See Also
Search LookupIconIdFromDirectoryEx in MSDN Library.
Example
Load Resources.dll to memory
\Extras\Resources.dll
Error
\Extras\Resources.dll not found.
Load RT_GROUP_ICON resource from Resources.dll library
